title: Your money or your life? Coronavirus-era economics makes us ask grim questions about how to value each other - The Globe and Mail
description: Long before COVID-19 cases rose and markets plummeted, economists had ways to measure what a human life is worth – but the public, and the health officials keeping them safe, have their own ideas about that too. Who should we listen to in this crisis, and the…
